paper_keywords: simultaneously wireless information and power transfer (SWIPT)
paper_abstract: We analyze the diversity-multiplexing tradeoff (DMT) of the dynamic harvest-and-forward (DHF) cooperation to clearly explain the achievable diversity order. Surprisingly, DHF cooperation with a relay that harvests energy from a wireless source achieves the same DMT as when the relay is connected to a fixed power supply, by supplying the energy harvesting (EH) period to be asymptotically small. For nontrivial EH period, however we show that the same DMT is achieved for a sufficiently small multiplexing gain (or corresponding large diversity gain), beyond which the DMT degrades.
paper_title: Diversity-Multiplexing Tradeoff of Dynamic Harvest-and-Forward Cooperation
